title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG Poland directors Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska explain how AI is already integrated into audit work, using tools like the AI Transaction Scoring Tool and Clara AI to analyze full populations, assist conversationally, and manage engagements in real time via the KPMG Clara platform. They discuss client benefits, the shift from sampling to full-population analysis, evolving auditor competencies, implementation challenges, data security and regulatory issues, and potential AI-related risks.
bullets: AI tools support repetitive tasks, large-scale data analysis, and decision-making in audits.
AI Transaction Scoring Tool enables analysis of entire data populations instead of sampling.
Clara AI offers conversational assistance and specialized agents; KPMG Clara manages audits in real time.
Clara for Clients modernizes client communication and collaboration during audits.
Discussion covers auditor role changes, required competencies, implementation challenges, data security, regulation, and AI risks.
takeaways: Expect audits to leverage full-population AI analysis—ensure your systems can provide complete, well-structured data on demand.
Prioritize data security, access controls, and compliance to meet heightened regulatory and audit scrutiny tied to AI-driven processes.
Enable secure, modern communication channels and APIs to integrate with client-facing platforms like Clara for Clients.
Maintain thorough documentation and strong internal controls to support AI analysis and respond to automated findings.
Develop staff skills for interacting with AI-assisted audit workflows and addressing insights generated by these tools.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Copilot provides real-time support for home projects and repairs. It can see what you see and delivers step-by-step instructions and clear guidance for issues like leaky pipes and overflowing washing machines.
bullets: Real-time support for home projects and repairs.
Visual understanding—Copilot can see what you see.
Delivers step-by-step instructions.
Targets common household issues (e.g., leaky pipes, overflowing washers).
Focus on clear, actionable guidance.
takeaways: Visual, step-by-step guidance capabilities could be applied to facility maintenance workflows to speed troubleshooting.
Real-time remote assistance may reduce the need for specialist dispatch for routine repairs.
Consistent, clear instructions can help standardize repair procedures and reduce human error.
Tools that 'see what you see' can support faster knowledge transfer for less-experienced onsite staff.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer highlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The 3D real-time strategy RPG casts you as the Endministrator exploring Talos-II; the trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode and includes links to learn more and follow the game on social channels.
bullets: Official launch of Arknights: Endfield showcased in a DLSS 4-enabled trailer.
Trailer captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Game described as a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator on Talos-II.
Includes links to the official game site and an NVIDIA article about DLSS 4 and Multi Frame Generation.
Provides developer and publisher social channels for follow-up (X, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok).
takeaways: Trailer capture used GeForce RTX 5080 with DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode — reproduce similar captures with equivalent RTX 50-series hardware.
NVIDIA published details on DLSS 4 and Multi Frame Generation — consult the provided NVIDIA link for technical and implementation info.
For promotional or benchmarking deployments, test 4K Ultra captures using DLSS 4 to match the trailer settings and visual fidelity.
Use official game and NVIDIA social/community links to coordinate releases or validate content and performance claims.

items.title: Rate Insurance Boosts Agent Efficiency with Agentforce and Gemini

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This Google Cloud video highlights how Rate Insurance boosts agent efficiency using Agentforce and Gemini. The description also links to information about the Google Cloud and Salesforce partnership for viewers who want to learn more.
bullets: Video showcases Rate Insurance improving agent efficiency with Agentforce and Gemini.
Published by Google Cloud on 2026-01-20.
Description includes a link to Google Cloud and Salesforce partnership details.
Focus is on operational improvement for insurance agents.
Short promotional/demo-style video (no transcript provided).
takeaways: Assess whether partner solutions (like Agentforce/Gemini) could reduce agent workload and improve operational efficiency.
Consider reviewing the Google Cloud–Salesforce partnership materials to understand integration and support options.
Evaluate potential vendor-led cloud deployments for customer-facing teams before committing to on-premise changes.

items.title: I Travel The World And Live Rent-Free By Pet Sitting Full Time

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Charly Stoever, 35, is a financial coach who has spent the last 18 months living out of two suitcases and living rent-free in Portland by pet sitting full time. She brings in about $60,000 a year, and the video is part of CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
bullets: Charly Stoever, 35, is a financial coach who pet sits full time.
She has lived rent-free in Portland for 18 months while traveling with two suitcases.
Her pet-sitting income is approximately $60,000 per year.
The story is featured in CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
Produced and reported by CNBC Make It staff (Lauren Shamo, Ryan Ermey, et al.).
takeaways: This profile documents a mobile, gig-based income model generating $60K/year while eliminating housing costs—consider how transient, remote workers rely on consistent digital services.
A subject living out of two suitcases for 18 months highlights demand for reliable, always-available connectivity and low-latency access across locations.
Supporting platforms used by full-time gig workers (scheduling, payments, remote work tools) can influence traffic patterns and capacity planning for distributed infrastructure.
Edge and distributed services that reduce latency and improve resilience could benefit transient users who depend on cloud-based tools while moving between locations.

items.title: New CO2 Battery Stores 8 Hours of Energy

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This giant carbon dioxide “bubble” battery can store about 20 megawatts of energy for roughly eight hours. The device is presented as a way to smooth renewable energy fluctuations and help power the global transition to clean energy.
bullets: Uses a large carbon dioxide bubble as the storage medium.
Stores approximately 20 megawatts of power.
Provides about eight hours of energy storage.
Aimed at addressing fluctuations in renewable generation.
Positioned to support a global shift to clean energy.
takeaways: Eight-hour duration offers multi-hour backup capacity relevant to grid balancing and extended outages.
20 MW scale indicates potential applicability for substantial loads or as part of larger storage portfolios.
Designed to mitigate renewable intermittency, making it a technology to watch for integration planning.
Grid and data-center planners should monitor development for operational and deployment details that could affect resilience and clean-energy goals.
